SVGAnimationElement.summary: The SVGAnimationElement interface is the base interface for all of the animation element interfaces: , , , and .

SVGAnimationElementEndEvent.summary: The endEvent event of the interface is fired when at the active end of the animation is reached.

blockquote.para: This event is not raised at the simple end of each animation repeat. This event may be raised both in the course of normal (i.e., scheduled or interactive) timeline play, as well as in the case that the element was ended with a DOM method.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

SVGAnimationElementBeginElement.summary: The method beginElement() creates a begin instance time for the current time. The new instance time is added to the begin instance times list. The behavior of this method is equivalent to beginElementAt(0).

SVGAnimationElementEndElementAt.summary: The method endElementAt() creates an end instance time for the current time plus the specified offset. The new instance time is added to the end instance times list.

SVGAnimationElementGetSimpleDuration.summary: The method getSimpleDuration() returns a float representing the number of seconds for the simple duration for this animation.

remarks.para: Simple duration refers to the length of time an animation is supposed to run for a single iteration, without considering repeats, restarts, or extensions.
This property reflects the {{SVGAttr("dur")}} attribute of the animate, animateMotion or animateTransform element.

SVGAnimationElementSystemLanguage.summary: The systemLanguage read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("systemLanguage")}} attribute of the given element.

SVGAnimationElementEndElement.summary: The method endElement() creates an end instance time for the current time. The new instance time is added to the end instance times list. The behavior of this method is equivalent to endElementAt(0).

SVGAnimationElementGetCurrentTime.summary: The method getCurrentTime() returns a float representing the current time in seconds relative to time zero for the given time container.

remarks.para: Time zero refers to the moment when the time container begins its timeline. It acts as the starting reference point for all animations within that container.

A time container is an element or context that defines a local timeline for one or more animations. Animations inside the time container are measured relative to its timeline. If a time container is delayed, paused, or manipulated, all animations within it adjust accordingly.

SVGAnimationElementBeginEvent.summary: The beginEvent event of the interface is fired when the element local timeline begins to play. It will be raised each time the element begins the active duration (i.e., when it restarts, but not when it repeats).

remarks.para: It may be raised both in the course of normal (i.e., scheduled or interactive) timeline play, as well as in the case that the element was begun with a DOM method.
This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

SVGAnimationElementRepeatEvent.summary: The repeatEvent event of the interface is fired when the element's local timeline repeats. It will be fired each time the element repeats, after the first iteration.

blockquote.para: Associated with the repeatEvent event is an integer that indicates which repeat iteration is beginning; this can be found in the detail property of the event object. The value is a 0-based integer, but the repeat event is not raised for the first iteration and so the observed values will be >= 1. This is supported in Firefox, but not in Chrome.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

SVGAnimationElementRequiredExtensions.summary: The requiredExtensions read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("requiredExtensions")}} attribute of the given element.

SVGAnimationElementGetStartTime.summary: The method getStartTime() returns a float representing the start time, in seconds, for this animation element's current interval, if it exists, regardless of whether the interval has begun yet.

remarks.para: The start time returned by getStartTime() is measured in seconds relative to the time container's time zero.
Time zero refers to the moment when the time container begins its timeline. It acts as the starting reference point for all animations within that container.

A time container is an element or context that defines a local timeline for one or more animations. Animations inside the time container are measured relative to its timeline. If a time container is delayed, paused, or manipulated, all animations within it adjust accordingly.
This property reflects the {{SVGAttr("begin")}} attribute of the animate, animateMotion or animateTransform element.

SVGAnimationElementTargetElement.summary: The targetElement read-only property of the interface refers to the element which is being animated. If no target element is being animated (for example, because the {{SVGAttr("href")}} attribute specifies an unknown element), the value returned is null.

SVGAnimationElementBeginElementAt.summary: The method beginElementAt() creates a begin instance time for the current time plus the specified offset. The new instance time is added to the begin instance times list.
